farms.title: Niagara
farms.description: A collection of small coffee producers in the western region known as 'the highlands' of Guatemala. With each 30kg bag of Hunbatz, we sell we plant a tree.
details: The owner and administrator of Finca El Niagara is Mynor Daniel Zamora Salazar, an agricultural engineer...
He is the third generation of coffee growers. Since Mynor’s grandfather acquired the farm, it has produced coffee...
Finca El Niagara has a complicated story through time...

farms.title: Hunbatz
farms.description: A collection of small coffee producers in the northwestern highlands of Guatemala, specifically in the Cuilco region of Huehuetenango, form the backbone of Hunbatz. For each 30 kg bag of Hunbatz coffee we sell, we plant a tree on behalf of the coffee roaster who purchased it.
details: Among the Mayans, the howler monkey god was a primary deity of art and music and a patron of the artisans, especially the scribes and sculptors.

According to the sixteenth-century Popol Vuh creation myth, two brothers, Hunbatz and Hunchouen, were once talented dancers and artists. By nature, these two sons were wise, and their wisdom was great. All the arts were taught to Hunbatz and Hunchouén, the sons of Hun-Hunahpú. They were flautists, singers, shooters with blowguns, painters, sculptors, jewellers and silversmiths.

The story goes that they climbed a tree; it grew up so tall that Hunbatz and Hunchouen could not get down. As they struggled in the branches, their loincloths came loose and turned into tails; they both became monkeys, one a spider monkey, the other a howler monkey.
